metadata.synopsis: Tadpole branches to convince Karlach. Handles both normal and astral tadpoles.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Recruit companion Karlach- For normal default branch:     SetGlobalOsirisFlag GLO_Daisy_State_Unlocked- For astral tadpole branch:     SetGlobalOsirisFlag GLO_Tadpole_State_ReceivedAstralTadpole- Speak with her and select "So - about our tadpole powers..." or "The Emperor has offered us a special tadpole. We'll become partial mind flayers, but we'll get great powers in turn..."

91.speaker: Karlach
91.text: Special tadpole? Bit of a contradiction in terms, don't you think? I don't even want a regular one.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: You're talking about turning into, what, a half-squid?

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: Then again... you can pull it off better than most.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: We need every advantage we can get. Give it some thought.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Consider it, Karlach. These powers could be the difference between victory and defeat.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: You've got to be kidding. You really want me to become a partial illithid? Wasn't a decade in Avernus punishment enough?
53.context: NodeContext: She's not angry, but she is incredulous.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I asked nicely. Do you want to know what comes after that?

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: What, you're going to strong-arm me, are you? I'd like to see how that ends for you.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: Where's that bloody worm? Stick it in my eye before I change my mind.
93.context: NodeContext: Sick of the player's shit but not mad at them

46.speaker: Player
46.text: If we finish this, and win, we'll be free. Really free.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: Ugh. I'm that easy to manipulate, am I?
50.context: NodeContext: A bit self-deprecating, cause the player has just convinced her.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: This isn't the way. I think you know that, deep down. You have my answer, all right?

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I really think we should do this, Karlach.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I understand if you don't want to make use of it. We won't speak of it again.

0.speaker: Karlach
0.context: NodeContext: Relieved, a little wry/dry. She didn't want to talk about this topic anymore.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: Not surprised you haven't tried it yourself yet.

95.speaker: Karlach
95.text: 'Great powers' huh? I'm sceptical. Thought you'd be too.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Especially if this thing wants to turn you into, what, a half-squid?

79.speaker: Karlach
79.text: Hmm. I guess the vanilla-flavoured tadpole has given us some enjoyable new tricks. But going half-mind flayer?

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: You really did it, huh? Not worried about adding more illithid into the mix?

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: Well, what can I say. You look fine. Smell fine. Seem fine.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: And yet... you're more mind flayer than ever.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Hope you don't expect me to follow your lead in this.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I was hoping you might. The benefits seem to outweight the costs.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: It's your choice. But I think the tadpoles make me stronger.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: Do they? I'm not sure either of us can say one way or the other. We don't know what the costs might be, just yet.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: We might be facing a cult more powerful than we know. We need all the help we can get.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: Argh. How do you do that? Always making sense when I least want you to.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: Fine. I'll keep an open mind, all right? I can promise that much.

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: You can say whatever you want; you aren't going to change my mind. Nothing will.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: I don't want to get more mixed in with this mind flayer shit than I already am. Got it?

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: You'd agree with me if that tadpole hadn't eaten the sensible part of your brain.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: We need to face the Chosen Three to get through this. Don't you want any advantage?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Can't you see by my example that this is worth our while?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You deserve power like this. You've earned it.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Think it through, Karlach. There's a lot to be gained here.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I don't expect you to do anything you don't want to do.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Good. And, you know, keep an eye on yourself. If you start feeling loopy, shout. We don't know what these tadpoles are capable of.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: If you got a little boost from the tadpole, who am I to begrudge you.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: In fact... got any going spare?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: If I did, would you accept it?

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: You know, I think I would. Bit surprising, but I'm starting to see the silver lining of this whole parasite situation.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I do - and it's all yours.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Sorry, but these are hard to come by. I'm keeping them for myself.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: Greedy goblin. But all right - I'll scout out my own, if needs be.

35.speaker: Karlach
35.text: Glad to see you haven't gone down the tadpole-slorping route yet. We still don't know if that visitor has our best interests in mind.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: These tadpoles could give us powers, you know.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I have to be honest - I'm giving it serious consideration.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: It's a free party. But I won't lie, that's... concerning.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I thought you might want to do it yourself.

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: I see you're hanging on to it there.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: If you're not going to use it, maybe I should?

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I didn't realise you were so interested.

89.speaker: Karlach
89.text: Well, I am. I want to be strong...er. I want every advantage I can get.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: All right - next tadpole we find is yours.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: Thanks, soldier. I'll use it well. Promise.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I'll have to think about it.

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: You and your thinking. Always doing it, huh.
